title: 1990 Peak AntiFreeze 500
text:
The 1990 Peak AntiFreeze 500 was a <a href="NASCAR">NASCAR</a> <a href="NASCAR%20Cup%20Series">Winston Cup Series</a> racing event that took place on September 16, 1990, at <a href="Dover%20International%20Speedway">Dover Downs International Speedway</a> in <a href="Dover%2C%20Delaware">Dover, Delaware</a>.
<a href="Phoenix%20Racing%20%28NASCAR%20team%29">Phoenix Racing</a> would make their "maiden voyage" into the NASCAR Cup Series; with veteran wheelman <a href="Jeff%20Purvis">Jeff Purvis</a> dominating the decision-making throughout the event. After suffering from a shoulder injury in practice, Lake Speed would be replaced by <a href="Tommy%20Ellis">Tommy Ellis</a>.
Background.
<a href="Dover%20International%20Speedway">Dover Downs International Speedway</a>, now called Dover International Speedway, is one of five <a href="Short%20track%20motor%20racing">short track</a>s to hold NASCAR races; the others are <a href="Bristol%20Motor%20Speedway">Bristol Motor Speedway</a>, <a href="Richmond%20International%20Raceway">Richmond International Raceway</a>, <a href="Martinsville%20Speedway">Martinsville Speedway</a>, and <a href="Phoenix%20International%20Raceway">Phoenix International Raceway</a>. The NASCAR race makes use of the track's standard configuration, a four-turn short track <a href="Oval%20track%20racing">oval</a> that is long. The track's turns are <a href="Banked%20turn">banked</a> at twenty-four degrees, and both the front stretch (the location of the finish line) and the backstretch are banked at nine degrees.
Race report.
<a href="Bill%20Elliott">Bill Elliott</a> managed to defeat <a href="Mark%20Martin">Mark Martin</a> (who would maintain the championship points lead after this race) by less than 1.4 seconds in front of 74,000 spectators. Elliott would earn the <a href="pole%20position">pole position</a> by qualifying at a speed of while the average race speed was . <a href="J.D.%20McDuffie">J.D. McDuffie</a> would make his final last-place finish before being killed at the <a href="1991%20Budweiser%20at%20The%20Glen">1991 Budweiser at The Glen</a> race (which took place at <a href="Watkins%20Glen%20International">Watkins Glen International</a>). The only driver that failed to qualify was <a href="Kerry%20Teague">Kerry Teague</a>.
Six cautions were handed out for 29 laps. The prize winnings for each driver varied from a then-incredible $83,100 ($ when inflation is taken into account) to a meager $2,650 ($ when inflation is taken into account). This would become the last Last ESPN race at Dover until the <a href="2010%20NASCAR%20Sprint%20Cup%20Series">2010 NASCAR Sprint Cup Series</a> season.
This was Jimmy Makar's first race as a Winston Cup Crew Chief. He replaced <a href="Barry%20Dodson">Barry Dodson</a> as Rusty Wallace's CC for the Blue Max team.
<a href="Tommy%20Riggins">Tommy Riggins</a> and <a href="Jerry%20Hufflin">Jerry Hufflin</a> would retire from the Winston Cup Series after this race. <a href="Bobby%20Wawak">Bobby Wawak</a> would also make his NASCAR exit as an owner after this racing event.
